page.title: 12PORTHALLOW
page.content: { PORTHALLOW} Porthallow is the other village in this block. It was once heavily involved in the Pilchard industry. The pub is called the Five Pilchards and has a lovely display of photographs and items retrieved from wrecks. The pub is right by the beach which is completely covered in smooth stones. When the tide is out a large edifice called Channel Rock can be reached. This village is very popular in the summer and accommodation is provided for tourists in bed and breakfast and holiday apartments. There is a post office which sells gifts and food. The old school is now an adventure centre run by the County's Youth Service. There are two tea rooms, one with a garden and the other is a converted fishing loft.
